page.title: 10Thermal Waters -Matlock Bath
page.content: {Water}has played an important part in the development of this area.The gorge of the{River Derwent}is one of the major scenic attractions causing the area to be described once as the most dazzlingly beautiful spot in Britain. Development may have altered this. Its nick-name is Little Switzerland. The{thermal springs}which bubble from underground formed the original basis for the development of Matlock Bath way back in 1698. The warm water (constant 20 degrees celsius) were used for bathing. They still fill the New Bath Hotel pool, the aquarium and the fish pond.They cause the formation of tufa and can be used to coat objects in the{Petrifying Well.
